message: I'm referring specifically to the US version
So, DjangoCon is run by the DSF, a 501(c)(3) organization.  I know that you can contact them officially, but I don't know where their reports are.

I'm curious because when Rob Lofthouse stepped down he said he was "handing the conference to the community" (that's not an exact quote). Maybe he didn't have the right to say that but it's not the only occasion where it's been referenced in that light.
Is it fair to expect that this information is made public?
Also, according to http://djangocon.us/, it was "a production of Steve Holden's Mighty Python Empire"
afaik, "djangocon" the name is owned by the DSF
that said, the conference is run by steve holden.
Also, @seanoc who may be able to shed some light.
Steve runs it on behalf of the DSF

@unbracketed: see the other DjangoCon thread for an explanation of the relationship between the DSF and Holden Web/SHMPE. I  have no knowledge of previous conferences. I'm going to be at DjangoCon EU, so we can talk it through there if you want.
+1 to what @holdenweb said altho I won't be at Djangocon.eu this year unfortunately
